name: SetupComponent

propertiesClass.name: completed$
propertiesClass.description:
Emits when the setup is done. You can add certain operations before completing the setup that needed to be awaited. Return true if everything is fine, otherwise false.

Example :
const asyncOperation = delay(2000);
this.setup.completed$ = this.setup.completed$.pipe(asyncOperation, map(() => true));

Note: Remember that a step can be viewed multiple times. The step needs to ensure, to only add a completed operation ones.
propertiesClass.rawdescription:
Emits when the setup is done. You can add certain operations before completing the setup that needed to be awaited. Return
true if everything is fine, otherwise false.

```typescript
const asyncOperation = delay(2000);
this.setup.completed$ = this.setup.completed$.pipe(asyncOperation, map(() => true));
```

Note: Remember that a step can be viewed multiple times. The step needs to ensure, to only add a completed operation ones.

propertiesClass.name: currentSetupState
propertiesClass.description: The current state. SetupState.START shows an application overview while SetupState.WIZARD shows the steps.
propertiesClass.rawdescription:
The current state. SetupState.START shows an application overview
while SetupState.WIZARD shows the steps.

propertiesClass.name: data$
propertiesClass.description: A subject which can be used to exchange data between steps.
propertiesClass.rawdescription:
A subject which can be used to exchange data between
steps.

methodsClass.name: cancel
methodsClass.rawdescription: Cancels the wizards and goes back to the start view.
methodsClass.description: Cancels the wizards and goes back to the start view.

methodsClass.name: finish
methodsClass.rawdescription: Finish the wizard and will start the application.
methodsClass.description: Finish the wizard and will start the application.

methodsClass.name: getByIndex
methodsClass.rawdescription: Returns a step by it index position in the wizard.
methodsClass.description: Returns a step by it index position in the wizard.

jsdoctags.comment: The step index that you want to receive.

methodsClass.name: start
methodsClass.rawdescription: Starts the wizards (or finish the setup if no steps are found)
methodsClass.description: Starts the wizards (or finish the setup if no steps are found)

methodsClass.name: stepCompleted
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Mark a step as completed. If the step is required, this is needed to fulfill
the setup.
methodsClass.description: Mark a step as completed. If the step is required, this is needed to fulfill the setup.

jsdoctags.comment: The index of the step you want to mark as completed
Defaults to true to mark it as completed but can be set to false to invalidate the step.

methodsClass.name: verify
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Verifies every step and checks if all required are completed.
Updates the icons to reflect the state of the steps (error, warning, done).
methodsClass.description: Verifies every step and checks if all required are completed. Updates the icons to reflect the state of the steps (error, warning, done).

jsdoctags.comment: Returns true if no error was found.

description: This component is the parent of each setup and can be injected into setup steps to control them.
rawdescription:
This component is the parent of each setup and can be injected
into setup steps to control them.
